newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak SUSR sees FY 1996 GDP growth of 6.8-7.0 pct.
newsitem.headline: Slovak SUSR sees FY 1996 GDP growth of 6.8-7.0 pct.

text.p: The Slovak Statistical Bureau (SUSR) said on Thursday that it expected full year 1996 GDP growth of 6.8-7.0 percent, down slightly from GDP growth of 7.4 percent in 1995.
SUSR added that it expected GDP growth of 6.5-6.7 percent in the first quarter of 1997.

"We expect first quarter 1997 GDP to be slightly above the Finance Ministry forecast of 6.0 percent...but significantly under the central bank's forecast," SUSR Chairman Stepan Sondik told a newsconference.
He did not elaborate on the reasons for the differing forecasts. The NBS's first quarter 1997 GDP forecast was not immediately available.
Sondik added that the bureau expects year-on-year inflation for 1996 to finish at "under six percent", down from 7.2 percent for 1995.

He said that industrial output in 1996 is forecast by SUSR to be +3.0-3.2 percent, up from 2.7 percent growth the previous year. For the first quarter of 1997, industrial production is expected to rise by 3.5-3.9 percent, year-on-year, he added.
Unemployment is forecast to end the year at 12.5-12.8 percent, down from 13.11 percent at the end of 1995.
